meanings.definition: A concluding piece of music played at the end of a church service.
meanings.sent1: The postlude after the church service was calming and beautiful.
meanings.sent2: The organist played a lovely postlude as the congregation left the church.
meanings.sent3: The postlude was so catchy that people hummed it all the way home.
meanings.sent4: The postlude echoed through the church like a gentle farewell whisper.
meanings.sent5: The postlude filled the air with a sense of peace and closure.

meanings.definition: The concluding section of a literary work.
meanings.sent1: In the postlude of the book, the author tied up all loose ends.
meanings.sent2: The postlude of the novel revealed the fate of the main characters.
meanings.sent3: The postlude of the story left readers with a sense of satisfaction.
meanings.sent4: The postlude of the play brought a sense of resolution to the audience.
meanings.sent5: The postlude of the poem left a lasting impression on the reader.

meanings.sent1: His postlude to the conversation was a heartfelt goodbye.
meanings.sent2: The postlude to her speech left the audience inspired.
meanings.sent3: The postlude to his joke made everyone burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: Her postlude to the meeting was a call for unity and cooperation.
meanings.sent5: The postlude to his presentation left a lasting impact on the listeners.
